subject: AI & Agents
title: Healthcare AI and Unequal Treatment
description: A micro-lesson that makes Healthcare AI and Unequal Treatment usable.

hook.text: A hospital algorithm ranked Black patients as healthier than equally sick white patients.

buildup.text: The system used healthcare spending as a proxy for health needs.

discovery.text: Due to systemic inequality, Black patients had less spent on them, so the AI assumed less need.

twist.text: The bias affected 200 million patients across the US healthcare system.

climax.text: Researchers fixed it by replacing the spending proxy with actual health measurements.

punchline.text: The wrong proxy turns inequality into a diagnosis.

quiz.question: Why did the healthcare algorithm underestimate Black patients' needs?
options: It used spending as a proxy, which reflected systemic inequality
It was deliberately programmed to discriminate
Black patients had fewer medical records
